III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Consultant provided feedback to add a line specifically to identify the relationship
of the reference when completing new hire references. The narrative of the

references reviewed within this audit did indicate the references were being
interviewed were not relatives and a suggestion was provided for the future to
make sure it clear at quick glance that the references are non-relatives to the
potential new hire.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The Supervisor of the facility discussed the difficulty of finding a dental provider
that accepts the youth's Medicaid insurance. This consultant provided
consultation to ask the parents or probation officer of the youth's last dental visit
upon admission for their medical records. It was also suggested to make sure the
facility documents all their attempts to schedule the dental appointment within the
youth's file.
• Consultant provided feedback to make sure all reports within the youth's files
have clear dates of when the report was completed to ensure accurate
compliance within timeframes. The reports that were reviewed had accurate
documentation for compliance for the rule but for consistency it is recommended
to document the date next to the name of the staff completing the report, so it is
easily identified.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and staff noted they feel
very supported within their job. Staff reported they have enjoyed working with the
youth and teaching them life skills within the facility, such as cooking. The staff
reported feeling very supported by their direct supervisor and administration team.
When asked about training, staff requested to continue to grow in their mental
health training as youth are coming in with more mental health concerns and
wanting to learn more techniques to support the youth.
Three youth were interviewed during the inspection. They all reported feeling safe
at the facility and noted staff are supportive of their positive growth. The youth
reported staff use a lot of verbal de-escalation when a youth is upset and noted
they have never seen a staff member restrain a youth.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on January 29, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
